channel.title: Slow lfo for audio loop disintegration?
channel.description:
Hi, i am fairly new to Axoloti, so excuse if this seems obvious or something... I've build myself a hardware controller with 5 buttons and 15 pots. The patch which i am working on should get you the basinski disintegration loops vibe. So i patched a looper going into some fx eg. some nasty distortion and some white noise. What i would like to do now is to push a button and start a slow lfo with that button that sets the amount of distortion. I got the lfo doing its thing, but i can't figure out how to start the lfo with a button. Hope you guys know what i mean since i don't know how to explain properly.
Basic question is: how can i start the loops destruction???
Other solution would be to slowly increase distortion with each repetition of the loop...
Please help, i am absolutely clueless...

The enclosure is made out of bits of wood I found laying around and a piece of transparent black acrylic which makes for a nice display panel that sort of hides the OLED when it's turned off.
